message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DB, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT 

This paper deals with the problem of privacy-preserving record linkage, which involves linking records from different datasets while preserving the privacy of the individuals whose data is being linked. This problem is relevant to several areas of computer science, including cryptography (cs.CR), databases (cs.DB), machine learning (cs.LG), data structures (cs.DS), and information theory (cs.IT). The paper proposes a novel approach based on frequent variable length grams, which involves mining patterns from the data in a private way and projecting the data onto a lower-dimensional space. This approach is likely to be of interest to researchers in all of these areas, but is particularly relevant to those working on privacy-preserving data mining and record linkage.
